required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Efficacy and Barrier Protection of Two Cosmetic Products
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Long-Term Efficacy and Barrier Protection of Two Skin Care Products

lead_sponsor.agency: Dr. August Wolff GmbH & Co. KG Arzneimittel

collaborator.agency: proDERM Institut für Angewandte Dermatologische Forschung GmbH

clinical_study.source: Dr. August Wolff GmbH & Co. KG Arzneimittel

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study was to assess the long-term efficacy and barrier protection properties of two cosmetic products on the volar forearms of 20 elderly subjects after four weeks of treatment compared to two untreated test areas.

primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline at Day 29 and Day 30 of Skin pH Units assessed by pH-meter

secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline at Day 29 and Day 30 of Transepidermal Water Loss (g/m2/h) assessed by Tewameter
Change from baseline at Day 29 and Day 30 of Skin Hydration Arbitrary Units assessed by Corneometer

secondary_outcome.measure: Intercellular lipid lamellae lenght (nm ICLL/1000 nm2 ICS)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline at Day 29 and Day 30 of stratum corneum assessed by transmission electron microscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: Lipid Analysis ((concentration of : Cholesterol (µg/slide), FFA (µg/slide), Ceramide EOS (µg/slide), Ceramide NP (µg/slide), Ceramide NH (µg/slide))
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline at Day 29 and Day 30 of corneocyte layer area assessed from the TEM data

arm_group.arm_group_label: A - Negative control (untreated) for product C
arm_group.description: On the forearms four test areas were located, which were labeled from A-D. Test area A contralateral to product C

arm_group.arm_group_label: B - Negative control (untreated) for product D
arm_group.description: On the forearms four test areas were located, which were labeled from A-D. Test area B contralateral to product D

arm_group.arm_group_label: C - Cosmetic Product WO 3741 with pH 4
arm_group.description: On the forearms four test areas were located, which were labeled from A-D. Test area C on the same arm like product D.

arm_group.arm_group_label: D - Cosmetic Product WO 4081-1 with pH 5.8
arm_group.description: On the forearms four test areas were located, which were labeled from A-D.

intervention.description: Application of the product on the pre-defined skin area on the forearms twice daily for four weeks
intervention.arm_group_label: C - Cosmetic Product WO 3741 with pH 4

intervention.description: Application of the product on the pre-defined skin area on the forearms twice daily for four weeks
intervention.arm_group_label: D - Cosmetic Product WO 4081-1 with pH 5.8

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written Informed Consent to participate in the study
- Willingness to actively participate in the study and to come to the scheduled visits
- Female and male (at least 30% male subjects)
- From 50 to 75 years of age, equally distributed
Exclusion Criteria:
- Female subjects: Pregnancy or lactation
- Drug addicts, alcoholics
- AIDS or infectious hepatitis if known to the subjects
- Conditions which exclude a participation or might influence the test reaction/ evaluation
- Participation or being in the waiting period after participation in similar cosmetic and/or pharmaceutical studies
- Active skin disease at the test area
- One of the following serious illnesses that might require regular systemic medication: insulin-dependent diabetes
- Moles, tattoos, scars, irritated skin, hairs, etc. at the test area that could influence the Investigation

overall_official.affiliation: proDERM Institute for Applied Dermatological Research, Germany

facility.name: proDERM Institute for Applied Dermatological Research
